Posted By: TexasDice (10/15/2013 10:04:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Watch closely, children. It's not often you see a card that makes any Magic player worth their salt drool rainbows, but isn't broken enough for people to complain about it.  
I really love Devotion. In terms of flavor, it makes the most sense of any mechanic I've ever seen. You are loyal to a color, and so that color rewards you. It prevents stuff from being splashed, because you can't splash something and then use devotion for that color, because there won't be enough of it, and splashing will take away from the devotion of the color you are using. Finally (and this is my favorite part), there is no colorless devotion so far, so ridiculously broken artifact decks (don't act like you don't have one) can't take advantage from this.  
This card exemplifies all of these things spectacularly.
posts.html:

Finally (and this is my favorite part), there is no colorless devotion so far, so ridiculously broken artifact decks (don't act like you don't have one) can't take advantage from this.
This card exemplifies all of these things spectacularly.

posts.post_content:
Saw this, and the Johnny/fanboy to *a certain particular series*(/worshiper of a side-story written pertaining to that series) in me had an instant overload.  
  
This is now on my wishlist of cards I want to see whenever I open a Theros pack. Not just because land cards with awesome abilities tend to be worth mad masses of money, but because of the kind of utility this card has to offer.  
  
Obviously, this works best in mono-color decks and/or decks built around utilizing chroma/devotion ([Leatherback Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leatherback Baloth), [Deity of Scars](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deity of Scars), [Primalcrux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primalcrux), [Khalni Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Hydra)... ***DROP THAT [GENESIS WAVE](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=GENESIS WAVE) AND LET THE ROFLSTOMPING BEGIN***). But if you're clever, you could get some decent use out of this in a multicolored deck, too.  
  
If you build you multicolored decks like I do and stuff them with as many multicolored cards as possible, you can still pull some decent stockpiles of mana from Nykthos. Ta... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
It's obvious just how good this card can be with mono decks. But what people seem to be overlooking is that this card is also very effective with multi-coloured decks.  
  
As long as you have a devotion to any given colour of 2 or more, it's effective as a mana converter, if nothing else. Running a GW deck and want to pump up your [Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blessing)? Even if you have no other white cards on the board, you can convert two Forest into white mana.  
  
Definitely a great card with mono-devotion decks; but in Standard, I'm including this in my multicoloured as well.
posts.html:
It's obvious just how good this card can be with mono decks. But what people seem to be overlooking is that this card is also very effective with multi-coloured decks.

As long as you have a devotion to any given colour of 2 or more, it's effective as a mana converter, if nothing else. Running a GW deck and want to pump up your Blessing? Even if you have no other white cards on the board, you can convert two Forest into white mana.

Definitely a great card with mono-devotion decks; but in Standard, I'm including this in my multicoloured as well.

posts.post_content: I'm really surprised no one has fully abused the new legendary rule and [Crucible of Worlds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crucible of Worlds) with this. Get your devotion up, tap [Nykthos, Shrine to Nix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nykthos, Shrine to Nix) make sure you keep 2 floating, then play another [Nykthos, Shrine to Nix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nykthos, Shrine to Nix) as your land for the turn and get out your big bomb or win con. Next turn, just keep cycling [Nykthos, Shrine to Nix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nykthos, Shrine to Nix) with [Crucible of Worlds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crucible of Worlds). Maybe I'm just thinking totally crazy here...

posts.post_content:
This is an incredibly powerful mana generator a la [Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle), [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers) or [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy) (though not as broken as the latter). The sheer weakness of land destruction in recent times makes this completely capable of generating an obscene amount of colored mana early, and you can't even destroy it with your own copy now that the legend rule has been modified.   
  
The fact that [Voyaging Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voyaging Satyr) exists in the same set is just icing on the cake. Get these while you can, they will be incredibly expensive.
posts.html:
This is an incredibly powerful mana generator a la Gaea's Cradle, Cabal Coffers or Tolarian Academy (though not as broken as the latter). The fact that Voyaging Satyr exists in the same set is just icing on the cake. Get these while you can, they will be incredibly expensive.

posts.post_content:
This is such an amazing card. I use it in my monoblue devotion deck in tandem with [Nightveil Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightveil Specter) and [Curse of the Swine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of the Swine).   
  
With Nightveil, I can access other colors of mana via the hybrid mana symbols in [Frostburn Weird](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frostburn Weird), [Nightveil Specter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightveil Specter), and [Judge's Familiar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Judge's Familiar) to cast an opponent's cards of any color (except green).   
  
With Curse of the Swine, the massive amount of mana it makes available allows me to just sweep the board of all of my opponents creatures (especially if I follow up with [Cyclonic Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cyclonic Rift)).  
  
Not to mention, of course, how phenomenal this card is at just ramping in any color you choose. 5/5
posts.html:

With Curse of the Swine, the massive amount of mana it makes available allows me to just sweep the board of all of my opponents creatures (especially if I follow up with Cyclonic Rift).

Not to mention, of course, how phenomenal this card is at just ramping in any color you choose. 5/5
